column4: I bought a new hp printer p1005 when I am using windows the stupid printer works perfectly but on my juanty sometimes it doesnt print at all or most of the times. what should I do please? :(
Does the HP P1005 understand Postscript?
How can I know this please?
Your printer should come with a manual. In the back, it will list the languages that the printer can understand.
Typically, HP printers understand HCL and Postscript (if memory serves me correctly).
This is what I know, also sometimes it works!
I am searching for its manual.
Good. :) Can you send a test page to the printer from your Linux box? Does the test page print?
Now it doesn't but some times it does!
Does the printer beep or flash? Perhaps there's a check box - "Pause before new page" or something - which must be checked in the driver.
The light is always green,
I am reading its manual and Linux is not in the supported OS list.
How can I activate "Pause before new page" please? where can i find this option?
Where can I find this box please? "Pause before new page"
Which printer driver is Ubuntu currently using?
Am sorry I don't know which one! how can I know this as well.

From your Ubuntu main menu, select System, then choose Administration. Under the Administration menu, you will find an icon labeled Printing. Select this tool and within several seconds the Printer Configuration Tool will open.
after "printing" what should I do please?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1495541 <-- it looks as if your HP P1500 series isn't a Linux favorite
Also, see http://hplipopensource.com/hplip-web...all/index.html
Thank you. :)
